citeinfo.title: Hydrographic Parameters and Plankton Time-series Observation of the Okhotsk Sea

descript.abstract:
Hydrographic parameters and plankton data. Observations occurred twice yearly along the standard sections, down to 500-1,500 meter depth. Results of historical observations since the 1950s were published as printed and electronic versions of an atlas.
[ Reference: PICES Scientific Report No. 18 2001, Proceedings of the PICES/CoML/IPRC Workshop on "Impact of Climate Variability on Observation and Prediction of Ecosystem and Biodiversity Changes in the North Pacific", http://www.pices.int/publications/scientific_reports/Report18/default.aspx. ]

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
